tasks: Ensure encryption of all user data in transit (TLS/SSL).
Verify the firewall rules are correctly configured to block unauthorized access.
Ensure DDoS protection mechanisms are active and tested regularly.
Monitor network traffic for unusual activity or signs of intrusion.
Ensure that all servers are patched and running the latest security updates.
Verify that strong password policies are enforced for server access.
Ensure two-factor authentication (2FA) is required for server administrators.
Perform regular vulnerability scans on servers.
Ensure user data is anonymized when stored to protect privacy.
Implement and enforce strong password policies for user accounts.
Ensure all sensitive user data is encrypted at rest.
Verify that user data is not logged or tracked unnecessarily.
Ensure secure storage of cryptocurrency in cold wallets.
Implement multi-signature wallets for large transactions.
Regularly audit cryptocurrency transactions for suspicious activity.
Ensure that no personal information is tied to cryptocurrency transactions.
Ensure comprehensive logging of all security-related events.
Monitor logs regularly for signs of suspicious activity.
Ensure that logs are stored securely and are protected from tampering.
Implement automated alerts for critical security events.
Ensure a clear incident response plan is in place and regularly tested.
Verify that incident response roles and responsibilities are clearly defined.
Ensure a communication plan is in place for notifying affected parties.
Perform regular drills to ensure the readiness of the incident response team.
